1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Operators on collection elements.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Elem
7  ( ropsElem,
8  
9    -- * member
10    consMember, relmapMember, relkitMember,
11    -- $member
12  
13    -- * ix-elem & iz-elem
14    consIndexElem, relmapIndexElem, relkitIndexElem,
15
16    -- * unroll
17    consUnroll, relmapUnroll,
18
19    -- * elem-begin
20    consElemBegin, relmapElemBegin,
21    -- * elem-end
22    consElemEnd, relmapElemEnd,
23    -- * uncollect
24    consUncollect, relmapUncollect, relkitUncollect,
25  ) where
26
27import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base               as B
28import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax             as S
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data               as D
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core               as C
31import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base           as Rop
32import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Message   as Msg
33
34-- | Implementation of relational operators.
35ropsElem :: (D.CContent c) => [C.Rop c]
36ropsElem = Rop.ropList "elem"
37    --        CONSTRUCTOR       USAGE                        ATTRIBUTE
38    [ Rop.def consElem          "elem /P -to /N"             "-coll . -to"
39    , Rop.def consElemBegin     "elem-begin /P -to /N ..."   "-coll . -to"
40    , Rop.def consElemEnd       "elem-end /P -to /N ..."     "-coll . -to"
41    , Rop.def (consIndexElem 1) "ix-elem /P -to /N /N"       "-coll . -to"
42    , Rop.def (consIndexElem 0) "iz-elem /P -to /N /N"       "-coll . -to"
43    , Rop.def consMember        "member /N /N"               "-elem -set"
44    , Rop.def consUncollect     "uncollect /P -to /N ..."    "-coll . -to"
45    , Rop.def consUnroll        "unroll /N /N -from /P ..."  "-term -content . -from"
46    ]
47
48-- ----------------------  member
49
50-- $member
51--
52--  Membership.
53--  Relmap @member@ @\/x@ @\/xs@ means
54--  @\/x@ is a member of @\/xs@.
55--
56--  - Input relation has both @\/x@ and @\/xs@,
57--    check content of @\/x@ is acturally the member of @\/xs@.
58--
59--  - Input relation has @\/xs@ and not @\/x@,
60--    add term @\/x@ as member of @\/xs@.
61--
62
63-- | Expand elements from collection.
64--
65--   >>> elem /list -to /x
66
67consElem :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c) => C.RopCons c
68consElem med =
69  do xs   <- Rop.getTerm med "-coll"
70     x    <- Rop.getTerm med "-to"
71     Right $ relmapMember med (x, xs)
72
73-- | Expand elements from collection.
74consMember :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c) => C.RopCons c
75consMember med =
76  do x    <- Rop.getTerm med "-elem"
77     xs   <- Rop.getTerm med "-set"
78     Right $ relmapMember med (x, xs)
79
80-- | Create @member@ relmap.
81relmapMember :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c)
82  => C.Intmed c -> S.TermName2 -> C.Relmap c
83relmapMember med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitMember
84
85-- | Create @member@ relkit.
86relkitMember :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c)
87  => S.TermName2 -> C.RelkitFlow c
88relkitMember _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
89relkitMember (x, xs) he1'@(Just he1) = kit2 where
90    kit2 | S.termsPN [xi, xsi] []   = relkitMemberCheck  xi xsi he1'
91         | S.termsPN [xsi]     [xi] = relkitMemberExpand x  xsi he1'
92         | otherwise                = Msg.unkTerm [x, xs] he1
93    [xi, xsi] = headIndex he1 [x, xs]
94
95relkitMemberCheck :: (Eq c, D.CSet c, D.CList c)
96  => Int -> Int -> C.RelkitFlow c
97relkitMemberCheck xi xsi he1' = Right kit2 where
98    kit2 = C.relkit he1' $ C.RelkitTest kitf2
99    kitf2 cs = let [xc, xsc] = [xi, xsi] `B.snipFrom` cs
100               in xc `D.isMember` xsc
101
102relkitMemberExpand :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c)
103  => S.TermName -> Int -> C.RelkitFlow c
104relkitMemberExpand _ _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
105relkitMemberExpand x xsi (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
106    he2      = D.headCons x he1
107    kit2     = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToMany False kitf2
108    kitf2 cs = let [xsc] = [xsi] `B.snipFrom` cs
109               in case xsc of
110                    _ | D.isSet  xsc -> map (: cs) $ D.gSet xsc
111                    _ | D.isList xsc -> map (: cs) $ B.unique $ D.gList xsc
112                    _ | D.isText xsc -> map (: cs) $ map (D.pText . B.li1)
113                                                   $ B.unique $ D.gText xsc
114                    _                -> [xsc : cs]
115
116
117-- ----------------------  index-elem
118
119-- | Expand index and element from collection.
120--
121--   >>> ix-elem /list -to /i /elem
122--   >>> iz-elem /list -to /i /elem
123--
124consIndexElem :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => Int -> C.RopCons c
125consIndexElem from med =
126  do xs     <- Rop.getTerm  med "-coll"
127     (i, x) <- Rop.getTerm2 med "-to"
128     Right $ relmapIndexElem from med (i, x, xs)
129
130-- | Create @ix-elem@ or @iz-elem@ relmap.
131relmapIndexElem :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => Int -> C.Intmed c -> S.TermName3 -> C.Relmap c
132relmapIndexElem from med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitIndexElem from
133
134-- | Create @ix-elem@ or @iz-elem@ relkit.
135relkitIndexElem :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => Int -> S.TermName3 -> C.RelkitFlow c
136relkitIndexElem _ _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
137relkitIndexElem from (i, x, xs) he1'@(Just he1) = kit2 where
138    kit2 | S.termsPN [xsi] [xi, ii]  = relkitIndexElemExpand from i x xsi he1'
139         | otherwise                 = Msg.unkTerm [i, x, xs] he1
140    [ii, xi, xsi] = headIndex he1 [i, x, xs]
141
142headIndex :: D.Head -> [S.TermName] -> [Int]
143headIndex he ns = ns `B.snipIndexFull` D.getTermNames he
144
145relkitIndexElemExpand :: forall c. (Ord c, D.CContent c)
146  => Int -> S.TermName -> S.TermName -> Int -> C.RelkitFlow c
147relkitIndexElemExpand _ _ _ _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
148relkitIndexElemExpand from i x xsi (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
149    he2      = D.headAppend [i, x] he1
150    kit2     = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToMany False kitf2
151    kitf2 cs = let [xsc] = [xsi] `B.snipFrom` cs
152               in case xsc of
153                    _ | D.isSet  xsc -> indexElem cs $ B.sort $ D.gSet xsc
154                    _ | D.isList xsc -> indexElem cs $ D.gList xsc
155                    _ | D.isText xsc -> indexElem cs $ map (D.pText . B.li1)
156                                                     $ D.gText xsc
157                    _                -> [xsc : cs]
158
159    indexElem :: [c] -> [c] -> [[c]]
160    indexElem cs = map (cons cs) . index
161
162    index :: [c] -> [(c, c)]
163    index = zip $ map D.pInt [from ..]
164
165    cons :: [c] -> (c, c) -> [c]
166    cons cs (ic, xc) = ic : xc : cs
167
168
169-- ----------------------  unroll
170
171-- | Unroll (expand) terms to tuples.
172--
173--   >>> unroll /term /content -from /1 /2 /3 /4
174
175consUnroll :: (D.CTerm c) => C.RopCons c
176consUnroll med =
177  do t   <- Rop.getTerm  med "-term"
178     c   <- Rop.getTerm  med "-content"
179     xs  <- Rop.getTerms med "-from"
180     Right $ relmapUnroll med (t, c, xs)
181
182-- | Create @unroll@ relmap.
183relmapUnroll :: (D.CTerm c) => C.Intmed c -> (S.TermName, S.TermName, [S.TermName]) -> C.Relmap c
184relmapUnroll med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitUnroll
185
186-- | Create @unroll@ relkit.
187relkitUnroll :: (D.CTerm c) =>  (S.TermName, S.TermName, [S.TermName]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
188relkitUnroll _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
189relkitUnroll (t, c, from) (Just he1) = kit2 where
190    kit2 | S.termsPN fromi [ti, ci]  = Right $ C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToMany False kitf2
191         | otherwise                 = Msg.unkTerm (t : c : from) he1
192    [ti, ci] = headIndex he1 [t, c]
193    fromi    = headIndex he1 from
194    he2      = D.headAppend [t, c] $ D.headMap (B.snipOff fromi) he1
195    kitf2 cs = let (fromc, cs') = fromi `B.snipBoth` cs
196                   cons (term, cont) = D.pTerm term : cont : cs'
197               in cons <$> zip from fromc
198
199
200-- ----------------------  elem-begin
201
202-- | Extract elements from collection.
203--
204--   >>> elem-begin /list -to /a /b /c
205
206consElemBegin :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
207consElemBegin med =
208  do coll <- Rop.getTerm  med "-coll"
209     to   <- Rop.getTerms med "-to"
210     Right $ relmapElemBegin med (coll, to)
211
212-- | Create @elem-begin@ relmap.
213relmapElemBegin :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (S.TermName, [S.TermName]) -> C.Relmap c
214relmapElemBegin med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitElemBy B.takeFill
215
216-- | Extract end-side elements from collection.
217--
218--   >>> elem-end /list -to /a /b /c
219
220consElemEnd :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
221consElemEnd med =
222  do coll <- Rop.getTerm  med "-coll"
223     to   <- Rop.getTerms med "-to"
224     Right $ relmapElemEnd med (coll, to)
225
226-- | Create @elem-end@ relmap.
227relmapElemEnd :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> (S.TermName, [S.TermName]) -> C.Relmap c
228relmapElemEnd med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitElemBy B.takeTailFill
229
230-- | Create @elem-begin@ or @elem-end@ relkit.
231relkitElemBy :: (Ord c, D.CContent c) => (c -> Int -> [c] -> [c]) -> (S.TermName, [S.TermName]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
232relkitElemBy _ _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
233relkitElemBy f (coll, to) (Just he1) = kit2 where
234    kit2 | S.termsPN [colli] toi = Right $ C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToOne False kitf2
235         | otherwise = Msg.unkTerm [coll] he1
236
237    [colli]  = headIndex he1 [coll]
238    toi      = headIndex he1 to
239    he2      = D.headAppend to he1
240    kitf2 cs = let [collc] = [colli] `B.snipFrom` cs
241               in f D.empty (length to) (list collc) ++ cs
242    list c | D.isSet  c   = D.gSetSort c
243           | D.isList c   = D.gList c
244           | otherwise    = []
245
246
247-- ----------------------  uncollect
248
249-- | __uncollect \/P -to \/N ...__
250consUncollect :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c, D.CDec c, D.CEmpty c) => C.RopCons c
251consUncollect med =
252  do coll  <- Rop.getTerm  med "-coll"
253     to    <- Rop.getTerms med "-to"
254     Right $ relmapUncollect med (coll, to)
255
256-- | Create @uncollect@ relmap.
257relmapUncollect :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c, D.CDec c, D.CEmpty c)
258  => C.Intmed c -> (S.TermName, [S.TermName]) -> C.Relmap c
259relmapUncollect med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitUncollect
260
261-- | Create @uncollect@ relkit.
262relkitUncollect :: (Ord c, D.CSet c, D.CList c, D.CText c, D.CDec c, D.CEmpty c)
263  => (S.TermName, [S.TermName]) -> C.RelkitFlow c
264relkitUncollect _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
265relkitUncollect (coll, to) (Just he1) = kit2 where
266    kit2 | S.termsPN icoll ito  = Right $ C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToOne False kitf2
267         | otherwise            = Msg.unkTerm (coll : to) he1
268
269    icoll    = headIndex he1 [coll]
270    ito      = headIndex he1 to
271    he2      = D.headAppend to he1
272    kitf2 cs = let [xsc]    = icoll `B.snipFrom` cs
273                   char     = D.pText . B.li1
274                   ys << xs = appendCount D.empty (length to) xs ys
275               in case () of
276                    _ | D.isSet  xsc  -> cs << (B.sort $ D.gSet xsc)
277                      | D.isList xsc  -> cs << (D.gList xsc)
278                      | D.isText xsc  -> cs << (map char $ D.gText xsc)
279                      | otherwise     -> cs << []
280
281appendCount :: a -> Int -> [a] -> [a] -> [a]
282appendCount fill num xs ys = loop num xs where
283    loop 0 _        = ys
284    loop n (x:xs2)  = x    : loop (n - 1) xs2
285    loop n []       = fill : loop (n - 1) []
286
